tt/utta
ತುತ್ತೇನೆ (-tttene) for the first person singular, -ತುತ್ತೀಯೆ (-tttheeye) for the second person singular, -ತುತ್ತಾರೆ (-tttare) for the third person singular, -ತುತ್ತೇವೆ (-ttteneve) for the first person plural, -ತುತ್ತೀರಿ (-tttheeri) for the second person plural, and -ತುತ್ತಾರೆ (-tttare) for the third person plural.

column2:
*Main verb with a present tense marker. Gender and person mapping is required.
*कर्ता with zero suffix.
* Should not be mistaken with the Hindi continuous aspect of the present tense. हो (होना) + रही (fem of aux verb रहना)+ है combine the verb stem (हो, which represents the basic meaning of the verb, i.e. “to be”), a form of रही (which represents the continuous aspect and is in agreement with the gender and number of the कर्म).
